Others: Rafael Devers has been playing with soreness in both of his shoulders for weeks.
Devers underwent an MRI on both his left and right shoulder on Saturday.
The Red Sox placed Devers on the 10-day injured list with left shoulder inflammation.
Devers' right shoulder injury worsened in Boston’s 4-2, 12-inning loss to the Twins on Friday night.
The Red Sox are falling farther out of the playoff race with a week to go in the regular season.
Devers started Friday’s game and went 1-for-4, but entering the top of the 11th inning, Devers was removed from the game.
Devers was laboring with his throws the entire game.
Cora said Saturday afternoon that he did not know yet if surgery would be on the table for Devers.
Devers landed hard on his right shoulder on a diving attempt against the Rockies on July 23.
Devers' right shoulder injury stacked on top of the left shoulder issue Devers had already been playing through for much of the year.
Devers' right shoulder injury was the reason why Devers did not play in the All-Star Game after being named an All-Star for the third time in his career.
Down the stretch, the Red Sox saw the signs that Devers' shoulder issues were plaguing him on the field.
Devers' right shoulder injury was the reason why Devers was removed from the game on Friday.
Devers could no longer catch up to fastballs, and in particular was unable to drive them to the opposite field.
In the field, Devers lost his arm strength at third base.
In his last 20 games and 84 plate appearances dating back to Aug. 30, Devers has a slash line of.164/.262/.178 with one double, no homers and four RBIs.
The 76-78 Red Sox are 7-13 in those games

Early in the season, Devers dealt with pain in his left shoulder and left knee that forced him to miss 11 of the team’s first 24 games, but he caught fire upon his return and stayed hot through the end of July, coming into August with a.979 OPS.
Devers will miss the rest of the 2024 season due to his shoulder injuries.
Trevor Story expressed pride in Devers' determination to play through his injuries.
